meanings.definition: A tool used for picking nuts
meanings.sent1: I used the nutpick to grab the walnut from the shell.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel found the nutpick very helpful in opening the acorn.
meanings.sent3: The nutpick decided to take a break after cracking too many nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers were like a nimble nutpick, swiftly extracting the almonds.
meanings.sent5: The shiny nutpick gleamed in the sunlight as it cracked open the hazelnut.

meanings.definition: To criticize or find fault with someone or something
meanings.sent1: She tends to nutpick every little detail in the project.
meanings.sent2: Please don't nutpick my presentation; I did my best.
meanings.sent3: The teacher couldn't help but nutpick the student's messy handwriting.
meanings.sent4: He would nutpick at her choices, never satisfied with anything she did.
meanings.sent5: Her constant nitpicking was like a never-ending nutpick, always finding something wrong.
